New Records: Evin Lewis scored 94 from 69 balls with eight sixes, a coruscating innings in a rain-affected game
Key Match Events: Evin Lewis was caught at long off by Bethell for 94, West Indies win by eight wickets with 55 balls to spare
Brandon King was caught at deep midwicket by Jacks for 30
West Indies 144-2 (Lewis c Bethell b Rashid 94)
WICKET! West Indies 118-1 (King c Jacks b Livingstone 30)
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Liam Livingstone’s reaction: 'I guess we need to get the rhythm of 50-over cricket as quickly as possible'
Liam Livingstone’s reaction: 'I don’t think we adapted that well. West Indies bowled really well and we lost wickets at key stages'
Liam Livingstone’s reaction: 'I think everybody saw what JT [John Turner] is about. I thought he bowled really well and was unlucky not to get a wicket which might have changed the game'
Post-Match Reflections: Liam Livingstone’s reaction: 'Disappointing day but we’ll come back on Sunday, Saturday, whenever it is!'
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies won a good toss and have completely outplayed England
Evin Lewis has form for administering this kind of punishment: he smashed 176 not out, with seven sixes, against England at the Oval in 2017
The required rate is below four, which means West Indies can sit on the dangerous Rashid
